Guinea faces the ghosts of dictatorship: 'We have a terrible past and a worrying future'
subhead: As Guinea's December 28 presidential election approaches, with little doubt surrounding General Mamadi Doumbouya's victory, the coup leader has increasingly cited Sékou Touré, the father of Guinea's independence. It risks reopening wounds from a dark time for part of the population.

After five years of civil war, Myanmar junta stages an election
subhead: The ruling junta touted the vote – which has been criticized by Western diplomats and the UN rights chief – as a return to democracy. Former civilian leader Aung San Suu Kyi remains in jail.

title: Chile election: 'The trauma of the 2020 protest movement has fueled the country's conservative shift'
subhead: Claudia Heiss, a political scientist at the University of Chile, analyzes the factors behind the popular vote that brought the ultra-conservative José Antonio Kast to power on December 14.

title: How the Swiss Alps are pushing higher to preserve access to snow
subhead: Zermatt, the famous ski resort at the foot of the Matterhorn, has invested hundreds of millions of Swiss francs to ensure skiing for its customers nearly year-round, despite global warming. It is a relentless strategy – criticized, but profitable.

title: Dog photographer, a new niche profession: 'The key is to avoid the tongue hanging out'
subhead: Even though the photo galleries of their 'parents' are typically replete with dog photos, a new generation of professional photographers is nonetheless making a living out of artfully crafted canine portraits.

Mariupol, Ukraine: A model city of 'new Russia'
subhead: Since 2015, photographer Gabriele Micalizzi has been documenting the Donbas region from the Russian side of the front line, an area where Moscow enforces very strict access conditions for journalists. In November, he secured permission to enter Donetsk Oblast, a region of occupied Ukraine, and traveled to Mariupol, a city destroyed by Russian forces in 2022, which has since been colonized and rebuilt in record time.

title: How dining etiquette reveals social divides among young people
subhead: Choosing a natural wine, slicing comté cheese the 'right' way, opening an oyster: For young people lacking the right social codes, embarrassment at the table is often inevitable.

title: Six thousand new perfumes in 2025: Why manufacturers are flooding the market
subhead: The perfume sector is experiencing a global consumption revolution: Young people are collecting bottles, and Chinese consumers are buying more and more. With L'Oréal leading the way, perfume has become the main sector driving the cosmetics industry.
